intro: Leptocladia densispina, commonly known as the dense-spined leathery liverwort, is a type of thalloid liverwort belonging to the family Ptilidiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, spiny structures that give it its common name, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a leafy thallus with a distinct, leathery texture and is often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporocarps. Leptocladia densispina is an important component of microhabitats in forest floors, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
